entry.title: New standard transaction types: time to schedule a blockchain split?
entry.summary: In this email exchange, Michael Gronager shares his thoughts on the Bitcoin "constitution" changes and suggests an alternative method for securing wallets. He explains that the current system requires customers to have three key addresses, whereas allowing clients to implement multisign transactions after receiving money would greatly simplify the problem and cover most use cases. Gavin Andresen responds by agreeing that scheduling a blockchain split is not the right solution at the moment and that new standard transactions are a good short-term solution. The email signatures indicate that Gronager is the owner of Ceptacle and director of NORDUnet A/S, while Andresen is a member of the Bitcoin-development mailing list.
